feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 01 at 9:20AM AKDT until November 02 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 4 to 8 inches. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. Winds gusting 30 to 50 mph, strongest inland and along the Western Capes.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bristol Bay

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 3:49AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIDESPREAD SNOW EVENT FOR SOUTHCENTRAL TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY... A low pressure system will move in from the west Tuesday, bringing a front that will lift from southwest to northeast over Southcentral beginning Tuesday night. Snow is expected to spread in over the Kenai Peninsula beginning Tuesday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Copper River Basin; Matanuska Valley; Southeast Prince William Sound; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula; Western Prince William Sound

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 01 at 10:39AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor is forecast to remain in Moderate flood stage the remainder of this week while continuing a slow decline. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Moderate flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 01 at 10:38AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Deland is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through late this week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 01 at 10:36AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to continue a slow decline and fall out of moderate flood and into minor flood stage late Wednesday. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate to minor flood impacts through mid week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 01 at 10:33AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 10:03AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIDESPREAD NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY... The combination of near record warm temperatures, very dry air, and gusty south winds will result in near critical fire weather conditions today. Winds will gust around 25 mph at times this afternoon, which would encourage any fire start to spread rapidly. Localized or brief red flag conditions are possible.
